Title.evidence: This systematic review and meta-analysis aimed to evaluate the effects of sugammadex on POUR and other postoperative recovery outcomes

Intervention.evidence: Randomized controlled trials (RCTs) and cohort studies comparing sugammadex with conventional reversal agents or no reversal agents were included.

Objective.evidence: This systematic review and meta-analysis aimed to evaluate the effects of sugammadex on POUR and other postoperative recovery outcomes

Number_Randomised.evidence: The analysis ultimately included 25 studies involving a total of 163,367 patients: 84,362 received sugammadex, while 79,005 received neostigmine, or did not receive an antagonist.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Meta-analysis revealed a significant reduction in the incidence of POUR with sugammadex use (Relative Risk (RR): 0.47, 95% Confidence Interval (CI): 0.34–0.64, P < 0.001).
